alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 10:00AM CDT until July 20 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Morgan County in east Tennessee... West Central Scott County in east Tennessee... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 1100 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past couple hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area over the next 2 hours with moderate to heavy rain from thunderstorms that are forming to the northwest. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. The heavy rains drain into Clear Fork River which drains north into Big South Fork in Scott County. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wartburg, Sunbright, Deerlodge, Rugby State Park, Rugby, High Point, Elgin, Robbins, Frozen Head State Park and Honey Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
